comment: The course is hard. I've taken this course 3 times with a different professor each time. She gives you printed notes the first few weeks and notes online, so you don't even need the book. She give unlimited pratice quizzes for each test online (she's the only professor who does this). If you shut up and listen you can understand her.

I found this class really difficult mainly due to the amount of material she covers in class. Print out the lecture notes and review the material daily. The connect h.w & quizzes really impact your grade. She allows 3 attempts and their not timed so that was helpful. Test are not bad their mostly comprised of multi. choice and analytical ?'s.

Impossible to understand but grades are fair and she allows multiple trys for assignments. If you have a study partner to help translate she is not too awful. You will do ALOT of work and you will need to stay current with class but some people only showed for tests because they could not understand the lectures and fiugred it out on their own

Incredibly difficult to understand, only grades are tests and homework on connect. If it were not for her accent sounding closer to mandarin than english she may be a decent teacher. But for now, find another professor.

Here are the rules: 1) print up her chapter lecture notes 2) go to class 3) fill in the chapter lecture notes in class while she is lecturing 4) take notes on material presented in class that may not be in her lecture notes 5) spend 4 to 8 hours studying for her exams from notes 6) earn an "A"  She cares about her students and it shows!!! A++ Prof.

Good teacher, though accent can create difficulties.  Attend class, DO HOMEWORK & QUIZZES which are on-line as they have impact on your grade.  Three tests, with cumulative final.  Prof.Shelly provides tons of study materials.  The class was more difficult than I expected, but if you attend class and work for it, you can make a good grade.

Meh. Hard to understand, bad accent, weird teaching style. Tests are very hard, homework is on connect with unlimited attempts, and those are your only two grades. Do yourself a favor and find another teacher.

The prof's extreme speech patterns (lallation) coupled with KSU's intentional butchering of the text book (KSU custom edition with references to "credit" and "debit" excised) render this class unintelligible. Recommend another section if not college.

The prof's extreme speech patterns (lallation) coupled with KSU's intentional butchering of the text book (KSU custom edition with references to "credit" and "debit" excised) render this class unintelligible. Recommend another section.

Great professor! Lecture notes for each chapter serve as great study guide for each tests. The homework and quizzes for each chapter can be taken up to 3 times to receive full credit and are great prep for the test. She is really helpful and genuinely cares about helpful students who try to help themselves first. Cracks jokes sometimes too.

BEST professor I've had at Kennesaw. Very helpful, and give you the material needed for the tests. The lecture notes for each chapter give you a great study guide for the tests, and the homework/quizzes really do help you on the tests. Multiples attempts to receiver full credit on hw and quizzes! Truly a rare find. Funny too!

Very good professor, she explains everything in detail.  She does have a heavy accent, but she tries really hard so you get used to it.  Great lecture notes.  Go to class and you will learn everything that is on the tests.
No Comments

hard to understand. you get used to her accent tho. easy homework. tests can be challenging. gave my class a reference sheet for one of our tests. one "group" project at end of semester. i think ill be able to pull a B in the class. advise: just stay focused.

Professor Ye is a wonderful teacher who really cares about her students' success. Her grading system is VERY fair and there is always at least 10 points of extra credit on each test. She does have an accent but that doesn't stop her from explaining the material well. Highly recommended!

I did not enjoy this class; professor tried to be helpful but it was not enough. Class notes are the main learning source,you'll see it all on the exam. Read the chapters if you cannot understand what professor is saying or just register for a different professor of you want to get something out of this class
Lecture notes were useful for studying exams.  She is very helpful and asks students for feedback on her teaching methods.  Her accent is strong, but she is an excellent teacher.

Shelly is very knowledgable when it comes to accounting. It is true that she is difficult to understand, but it is not crucial to the course.  She hands out excellent lecture notes which are based off the book and her own methods. You will not need the book because her lecture notes cover all the information on the test.  I would reccomend her.
Professor was difficult to understand which made it tough to learn. Makee sure to read text book as it will teach you more than the lectures. Would recommend using another professor.
I couldn't understand a word this professor said all semester...once she takes some english courses, it may be doable
